snippet: Ms. Akerman, a Belgian whose latest work is at the New York Film Festival, created ruminative observations of women, sometimes punctuated by violence.

byline.contributor: Rachel Donadio reported from Paris, and Cara Buckley from New York.
byline.original: By RACHEL DONADIO and CARA BUCKLEY

abstract: Chantal Akerman, Belgian director whose meticulous cinematic observations of women's inner lives made her a pioneer in feminist filmmaking, and who was hailed by German director Rainer Werner Fassbinder as one of the most important European directors of her generation, dies at age 65.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Akerman, a Belgian whose latest work is at the New York Film Festival, created ruminative observations of women, sometimes punctuated by violence.

headline.print_headline: Chantal Akerman, Whose Films Examined Women’s Inner Lives, Dies at 65
headline.main: Chantal Akerman, Whose Films Examined Women’s Inner Lives, Dies at 65
